meanings.definition: Snatchier (adjective): having a tendency to snatch or grab quickly
meanings.sent1: The cat's snatchier paws caught the mouse before it could escape.
meanings.sent2: The thief's snatchier movements made it hard for anyone to catch him.
meanings.sent3: The snatchier squirrel quickly gathered all the nuts in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her snatchier reflexes were like a superhero's, always ready to save the day.
meanings.sent5: The snatchier wind snatched away the hat from the child's head.

meanings.definition: Snatchier (noun): a person or thing that snatches or grabs quickly
meanings.sent1: The eagle was a snatchier, swooping down to catch its prey with precision.
meanings.sent2: The snatchier in the crowd managed to grab the last ticket before anyone else.
meanings.sent3: The little boy was known as the snatchier in the playground for always winning at tag.
meanings.sent4: The snatchier of the group quickly grabbed the attention of everyone with their jokes.
meanings.sent5: The snatchier of the siblings always got the biggest slice of cake at birthdays.

meanings.definition: Snatchier (verb): to grab or seize quickly and forcefully
meanings.sent1: She tried to snatchier the toy away from her brother before he broke it.
meanings.sent2: The magician would snatchier a card from the deck and surprise the audience.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon managed to snatchier the shiny object and run off with it.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to snatchier the moments away as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The waves snatchiered the sandcastle back into the sea with each crash.
